newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt to offer 64 hotels for privatisation.
newsitem.headline: Egypt to offer 64 hotels for privatisation.

text.p: Egypt will send details of 64 hotels earmarked for privatisation to 30 to 40 institutions, the minister in charge said in an interview published on Wednesday.

Public Enterprise Minister Atef Obeid told the weekly magazine al-Mussawar his ministry would complete the preparatory documents by the beginning of July and send out the invitations to the potential investors in August.
The state hotel sector has fallen far behind in the government's privatisation programme despite a boom in tourism over the past two years.
The minister said the hotels would be offered to investors in groups, with each group to operate as a single company.
